law.text: The secretary shall, except as otherwise provided in KRS 439.250 to 439.560 and KRS Chapter 13A, have the power and authority to promulgate administrative regulations he or she deems necessary or suitable for the proper administration of the functions of the cabinet or any division in the cabinet, including qualification for the receipt of federal funds and for cooperation with other state and federal agencies. The secretary may delegate to any person appointed the power and authority as he or she deems reasonable and proper for the effective administration of the cabinet.
law.history: Amended 2007 Ky. Acts ch. 85, sec. 223, effective June 26, 2007. -- Amended 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 13, sec. 10, effective July 14, 1992. -- Amended 1982 Ky. Acts ch. 344, sec. 3, effective July 15, 1982. -- Amended 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 74, Art. V, sec. 24(14). -- Created 1956 Ky. Acts ch. 157, sec. 8.
